Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a go-ahead two-run homer in the bottom of the fifth
Teoscar Hernandez put the boys in blue right back ahead with a go-ahead solo shot
Mookie Betts followed Ohtani's homer up by casually flipping a 100mph fastball over the left-field wall to give the Dodgers a 6-5 lead and the win
Back-to-back home runs to win a game is not something seen every day
Pre-Game Insights: There wasn't much at stake in the Los Angeles Dodgers' series against the Colorado Rockies this weekend
The Dodgers are still determined to stay ahead of the San Diego Padres and clinch the National League West division title
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers attacked the series with the same energy and emotion as if it were the playoffs
Ohtani's addition to the Dodgers' already deep and dangerous lineup with hopes he can help them get over the hump this postseason
If he continues his clutch hitting, Hernandez could end up being the lineup addition that breaks the annual curse of Dodger bats freezing up in October
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers dropped the middle game on Saturday 6-3
Walker Buehler’s start wasn’t particularly great as he surrendered four runs, but he competed and kept the Dodgers in the game through five and a half innings of work
Sunday's game was by far the most entertaining
